Battleship Game Rules

Here are the rules for the web-based Battleship game:

  • Objective: Sink all of your opponent's ships before they sink yours.
  • Setup:
    • Each player has a gameboard to place their ships.
    • Ships vary in length and are placed either horizontally or vertically on the grid.
    • Players can manually place ships or use a random placement feature.
  • Gameplay:
    • Players take turns attacking the opponent's gameboard by selecting grid coordinates.
    • If the attack hits a ship, the corresponding ship's hit() function is triggered.
    • Missed shots are recorded on the gameboard and displayed visually.
    • A ship is considered sunk when the number of hits equals its length.
  • Winning:
    • The game ends when all of one player's ships have been sunk.
    • The first player to sink all their opponent's ships wins.
  • Features:
    • The computer opponent can make random legal moves to attack the player's gameboard.
    • The game alternates turns between the player and the computer until a winner is determined.
    • Gameboards display both hits and missed shots for easy tracking.
  • Implementation Notes:
    • Ships are objects with properties for length, hits, and a function to check if they are sunk.
    • The gameboard manages ship placement, tracks attacks, and reports the game state.
    • Event listeners handle user actions like placing ships and attacking coordinates.
    • Game logic is tested through unit tests rather than relying on the DOM during development.

Good Luck and Sink Those Ships!
